hello I'm Ernest a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dallas today I'm going to show you how
to resolve a host header that's missing
or not valid in Amazon open search
service let's get started there are a
few approaches to consider to resolve
the users not authorized to perform this
action error the first approach is to
set the appropriate value for the host
header the following example command
specifies the domain name as the host
header value
here's an example that uses an AWS
endpoint URL
the second approach is to launch your
open search domain using an Amazon
virtual private cloud
using an Amazon VPC to launch your open
search servers domain provides an added
layer of security
a VPC also allows you to manage access
to the domain through security groups
when you create a domain with VPC access
the endpoint looks like this
the third approach is to use a
resource-based access policy instead of
an open access policy that specifies AWS
identity and access management roles or
restrace requests to an IP address or
cider range
for example the following IP based
policy allows requests in the
11.11.11.11 32 cider range requested
domains in this range are allowed and
the valid host header request metric
isn't recorded regardless of the whole
Setter value the last approach is to use
fine-grained access control or fgac
along with resource-based access
policies to manage data access to your
open search service domain
fine green Access Control offers
benefits such as role-based Access
Control security at the index document
and field level open search dashboards
multi-tenancy and HTTP basic
authentication for open search service
and open search dashboards because fgac
is based on roles user credentials are
evaluated when authenticating a request
if fine green access access control
authenticates a user then the invalid
host header request metric isn't
recorded
so now you know how to resolve a host
header that's missing or not valid in
Amazon open search servers
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
foreign
[Music]
